div.h3: Our mission is to prepare 21st century students to think and succeed in a diverse, technological and ever-changing world through a partnership of homes, school and community.

li.a: KEYS in the Detroit Free Press

div.p: Governor Whitmer has announced that all Michigan schools will be closed for the remainder of the school year, in an effort to mitigate the threat of the Coronavirus.
What does that mean for KEYS Students?
ELEMENTARY STUDENTS, here’s what we have planned for the remainder of the year:
-The following resources will all be available:
MIDDLE SCHOOL STUDENTS, here’s what we have planned for the remainder of the year:
Google Classroom for each teacher and class. Teachers will be posting assignments daily and will often provide video lessons.

For information on how to set up your account and gain access to the online classrooms, head over to our Instagram Page, where we’ve posted each teachers classroom Instagram Account: https://www.instagram.com/keysacademies/?hl=en
Also, Math Packets have been sent home with our food deliveries. These are to be returned back every three weeks.
Additionally, KEYS will provide delivery and pick-up options for both breakfast and lunch meals throughout the closure period.
Please be sure to visit our page throughout this extended closure to find out more about the distance learning program, and don’t hesitate to reach us directly by phone, email or social media.

strong.span: KALASHO EMPOWERMENT OF YOUNG SCHOLARS, LLC

div.h1: KEYS Grace Academy COVID-19 Guidance on Distance Learning & Virtual Instruction

h2.strong: Here is a link to our authorizer-approved Instructional Continuity Plan.

div.h2: Virtual learning classrooms are open to all middle school students. Elementary students have home access to FastForWord, Spelling City, eSpark, NWEA MAP Skills and Get Epic. Our goal is to provide meaningful enrichment opportunities online for students by grade-level and subject areas. Students will be encouraged to participate in activities/tasks, which will be reviewed but not assessed.You can expect teachers to check-in with their students daily, via ZOOM, phone calls, and Instagram. Please do not hesitate to reach out to teachers if your child is having difficulty accessing the learning activities. We have and will continue to provide technology (laptops, tablets, wifi cards) to our students. Our staff will be flexible during this challenging time.
Online platforms for Elementary Students with links: Fast ForWord, Spelling City, eSpark, NWEA MAP Skills, and Get Epic.

Virtual learning for Middle School Students will occur via Google Classroom. If accessing Google Classroom via mobile phone, you can download the app or access it using the following link: https://classroom.google.com. Step-by-step directions for signing-in to Google Classroom can be found at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OFjQK7xy7Xk For information on how to set up your account and gain access to the online classrooms, head over to our Instagram Page, where we’ve posted each Teachers Classroom Instagram Account: https://www.instagram.com/keysacademies/?hl=en
Middle School Math Packets have been delivered with food deliveries.

Additionally, KEYS will provide delivery and pick-up options for both breakfast and lunch meals throughout the closure period. Please be sure to visit our page during this extended closure to find out more about the distance learning program from now until the end of the school year, and don’t hesitate to reach us directly by phone, email or social media.
